intro: Oldenlandia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, with small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and they bloom throughout the growing season. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
